channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: National Reconciliation Week
item.description:
Sunday, May 28, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit all colours to recognise National Reconciliation Week.

This year's theme "Be a Voice for Generations". Acknowledges a significant date in the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Community and is a time for all Australians to learn about our shared histories, cultures, and achievements, and to explore how each of us can contribute to achieving reconciliation in Australia.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong
item.xCal:location: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha

item.title: 2023 Statehood Day of Croatia
item.description:
Tuesday, May 30, 2023

Sandgate Hall will be lit Red, White and Blue to recognise 2023 Statehood Day of Croatia.

With more than 50,000 Croatians live in Queensland and we would like to take this opportunity to mark the Statehood Day of Croatia which is on May 30.

This Light Up is organised by: Consulate General of The Republic of Croatia

Venue: Sandgate Town Hall, Sandgate
Venue address: Sandgate Town Hall, Cliff and Seymour Streets, Sandgate

item.title: Darkness to Daylight 100km overnight run
item.description:
Tuesday, May 30, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Purple to support Darkness to Daylight 100km overnight run.

The Darkness to Daylight event is Challenge DV's flagship fundraising and awareness event which consists of a 110km overnight run, 110km monthly running challenge, and a 10km and 3km community mass-participation event. The event raised $420000 in 2022 and aims to do even better in 2023.

This Light Up is organised by: Challenge DV

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description:

This Light Up is organised by: Challenge DV

item.title: World MS Day
item.description:
Tuesday, May 30, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Red to support World MS Day.

Each year on 30 May we celebrate the World MS day with different themes each year, chosen by Multiple Sclerosis International Federation. Around the globe MS communities raise awareness, share stories and campaign with and for everyone affected by multiple sclerosis. It is a day where we celebrate global solidarity and hope for the future.

This Light Up is organised by: MS Queensland

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
item.xCal:description:
The Story Bridge will be lit Red to support World MS Day.
Each year on 30 May we celebrate the World MS day with different themes each year, chosen by Multiple Sclerosis International Federation. Around the globe MS communities raise awareness, share stories and campaign with and for everyone affected by multiple sclerosis. It is a day where we celebrate global solidarity and hope for the future.
This Light Up is organised by: MS Queensland

item.title: State of Origin Game I
item.description:
Wednesday, May 31, 2023

Sandgate Hall will be lit Maroon to support State of Origin Game I.

The Queensland Maroons won the bragging rights to last year's State of Origin by winning the Game I at Accor Stadium and Game III at Suncorp. The New South Wales Blues convincingly won Game II at Optus Stadium in Perth.  Adelaide Oval is hosting Game I, 2023 as we watch with anticipation to see who will secure the early lead. We know who we are backing! You've got this Queensland!

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Sandgate Town Hall, Sandgate
Venue address: Sandgate Town Hall, Cliff and Seymour Streets, Sandgate

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

item.title: Lifeline Giving Day
item.description:
Thursday, June 1, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to support Lifeline Giving Day.

Lifeline Queensland's Annual Giving Day is being held on Thursday 1 June, 2023. The Giving Day raises funds to recruit, train and support the volunteers who can save the lives of Queenslanders in crisis.

This Light Up is organised by: UnitingCare Queensland

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: National Reconciliation Week
item.description:
Thursday, June 1, 2023

City Hall will be lit in the colours of the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Island Flags to recognise National Reconciliation Week.

This year's theme "Be a Voice for Generations", acknowledges a significant date in the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Community and is a time for all Australians to learn about our shared histories, cultures, and achievements, and to explore how each of us can contribute to achieving reconciliation in Australia.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: International Myasthenia Gravis Awareness Month
item.description:
Friday, June 2, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Teal to support International Myasthenia Gravis Awareness Month.

Myasthenia Gravis is a neurological auto-immune condition and affects the transmission of messages between nerves and the muscle fibre. www.mgaq.org.au .  International Myasthenia Gravis Awareness Month spreads awareness  of Myasthenia Gravis, the impact it has on people and the message of  "Patient Voices Matter".

This Light Up is organised by: Myasthenia Gravis Association of Queensland Inc (MGAQ)

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong
item.xCal:location: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha

item.title: Italian Independence Day
item.description:
Friday, June 2, 2023

City Hall will be lit Red, White and Green to recognise Italian Independence Day.

Each year on June 2 Italy celebrates Festa della Repubblica – Italy’s National Day. It is a day that is celebrated with ceremony, colour, events and festivities.

This Light Up is organised by: com.it.es. Qld + NT

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

This Light Up is organised by: Com.It.Es. Qld + NT

item.title: Mabo Day
item.description:
Saturday, June 3, 2023

Sandgate Town Hall will be lit the colours of the Torres Strait Island Flag to recognise Mabo Day.

Mabo Day is held on 3 June each year and commemorates Eddie Koiki Mabo, a Torres Strait Islander who campaigned for Indigenous land rights. Council will support community events that acknowledge Mabo Day and commemorate the legacy of Eddie Mabo.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue: Sandgate Town Hall, Sandgate
Venue address: Sandgate Town Hall, Cliff and Seymour Streets, Sandgate

item.title: 2023 Brisbane Marathon Festival
item.description:
Sunday, June 4, 2023

City Hall will be lit Blue to celebrate 2023 Brisbane Marathon Festival.

Brisbane Marathon Festival is a mass participation running event held within Brisbane that includes a Marathon (42.2km), Half Marathon (21.1km), 10km, 5km and 2km race.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Thank a First Responder Day
item.description:
Monday, June 5, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Teal to support Thank a First Responder Day.

7th June 2023 is Thank a First Responder Day.  First responders are ordinary people. They have families, commitments, and homes to go to at the end of their working day. They’ve got dinner to make, shopping to do, and bills to pay. But they also dedicate every day to protecting and keeping us safe. We ask you to join us in saying two simple words to our first responders: Thank you.

This Light Up is organised by: Fortem Australia Ltd

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Queensland Day
item.description:
Tuesday, June 6, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Maroon to recognise Queensland Day.

Queensland Day is a celebration of Queensland's birthday and its official separation from New South Wales as an independent colony in 1859. Commemorated annually on June 6th, Queensland Day is an important celebration of our state’s culture and heritage and an opportunity to reflect on what Queensland means to you. It is an opportunity for businesses, community groups, organisations, schools, sporting teams and families to come together and share their state pride.

This Light Up is organised by: Department of the Premier and Cabinet

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

Commemorated annually on June 6th, Queensland Day is an important celebration of our state’s culture and heritage and an opportunity to reflect on what Queensland means to you. It is an opportunity for businesses, community groups, organisations, schools, sporting teams and families to come together and share their state pride.

This Light Up is organised by: Department of the Premier and Cabinet

item.title: World Haemochromatosis Week
item.description:
Wednesday, June 7, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Red to support World Haemochromatosis Week.

World Haemochromatosis Week is an opportunity to focus attention on Haemochromatosis and the risk of inherited iron overload both here in Australia as well as overseas. The key messages of the week are: - Haemochromatosis is the most common genetic disorder in Australia - If you are the 1 in 200 affected, it can cause serious health problems - Ask your doctor, find out if you are storing too much iron.

This Light Up is organised by: Haemochromatosis Australia

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Hidradenitis Suppurativa Awareness Week
item.description:
Thursday, June 8, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Purple to support Hidradenitis Suppurativa Awareness Week.

Hidradenitis Suppurativa Australia is going to break barriers and stigma so that diagnosis and treatment can begin earlier. The support group will offer monthly online meetings with others living with HS and focus on advocacy for HS warriors. Raising awareness of the condition so that people can get diagnosed earlier and start treatment to avoid severe complications.

This Light Up is organised by: Hidradenitis Suppurativa Australia

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Legacy Centenary Torch Relay
item.description:
Friday, June 9, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Red, Blue and White to support Legacy Centenary Torch Relay.

Celebrating 100 Years of Legacy supporting the families of Australia's fallen and injured veterans. The Legacy Centenary Torch Relay 2023 is a six-month campaign to pay homage to and acknowledge veterans’ families, saluting their sacrifice.  The torch will travel over 50,000 kilometres through 100 locations, carried by approximately 1,500 Torch Bearers.  The relay begins on Anzac Day, 25 April 2023, in Pozieres, France and will travel to London, England, where it will continue its tour throughout Australia arriving in Brisbane on Friday June 9, 2023.

This Light Up is organised by: Legacy Club of Brisbane

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: International Myasthenia Gravis Awareness Month
item.description:
Saturday, June 10, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Teal to support International Myasthenia Gravis Awareness Month.

Myasthenia Gravis is a neurological auto-immune condition and affects the transmission of messages between nerves and the muscle fibre. www.mgaq.org.au .  International Myasthenia Gravis Awareness Month spreads awareness  of Myasthenia Gravis, the impact it has on people and the message of  "Patient Voices Matter".

This Light Up is organised by: Myasthenia Gravis Association of Queensland Inc (MGAQ)

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

This Light Up is organised by: Myasthenia Gravis Association of Queensland Inc (MGAQ)

item.title: Fight MND and 2023 Big Freeze
item.description:
Sunday, June 11, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Blue to support Fight MND and 2023 Big Freeze.

This campaign aims to shine a light on the battle being fought by thousands of people across Australia who are diagnosed with MND. Currently there are no viable treatments and no cure for MND, and with continued research we aim to eventually make MND a thing of the past.

This Light Up is organised by: Cure for MND Foundation

item.title: Philippine Independence Day
item.description:
Monday, June 12, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Red, White and Blue to recognise Philippine Independence Day.

The Philippine Declaration of Independence was proclamied on June 12th 1898. Today the Chamber of Commerce and Industry Australia Philippines Incorporated would like to focus on Brisbane as the City and its Filipino-Australians residents, joining together to recognise the Philippines 125th Independence Day.

This Light Up is organised by: Chamber of Commerce and Industry Australia Philippines Inc

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Philippine Independence Day
item.description:
Monday, June 12, 2023

Sandgate Town Hall will be lit Red, White and Blue to support Philippine Independence Day.

To ensure an audience of at least 100,000+ worldwide (through social media) will focus on Brisbane as the City and its Filipino-Australians residents join together to recognise the Philippines 125th Independence Day. Last year's Light Up for the 124th Philippines Independence Day (on its 3rd year) attracted 18,000+ views in the Chamber's FB page. This year's 125th anniversary will have a much larger audience as the anniversary dinner is planned to be held at one of the function areas at the Sandgate Town Hall.

This Light Up is organised by: Chamber of Commerce and Industry Australia Philippines Inc

Venue: Sandgate Town Hall, Sandgate
Venue address: Sandgate Town Hall, Cliff and Seymour Streets, Sandgate

item.title: National Blood Donor Week
item.description:
Tuesday, June 13, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Red to support National Blood Donor Week.

Australian Red Cross Lifeblood is committed to providing life-giving essence to support the everyday wellbeing of all Australians — through blood, plasma, transplantation and biological products. National Blood Donor Week celebrates the Lifeblood donor community and acknowledges the amazing efforts of our donors and the people who receive blood products. The week also gives Lifeblood an opportunity to inspire others to become donors.

This Light Up is organised by: Australian Red Cross Lifeblood

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong
